comments.content: Similar, less detail, no stitches: **[Tiki Palms](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225000958/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=House-Industries&ffam=TikiPalms%20-%20Regular&fid=505662e842074fb43a177aef30df0671&fsize=60&text=abcdefghijkl&fit=1)** by House Industries (1993-1997)

Confucius/Castaway. See this old MyFonts forum post:  
 [http://www.rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225000958/http:/www.rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html "http://www.rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html")

Yet another similar bamboo font, Tiki:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tiki/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225000958/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tiki/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tiki/")  
don

And Bamboozle  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/bamboozle/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225000958/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/bamboozle/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/bamboozle/")  
This is a real fantasy version. My experience with cutting bamboo in the tropics is that it is impossible to bend it.  
Don
